discussion.content:
BDE

 Prisma Cloud scans all hosts for compliance issues, provided that a defender is installed or the host is covered by an agentless scan. Among these, the following compliance issues are covered.
 -Host configuration
 -Docker daemon configuration
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/compliance/host_scanning

Selected Answer: ABD
ABD for exclusion.

Prisma Cloud helps enterprises monitor and enforce compliance for hosts, containers and serverless environments.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/compliance

questions.question_text: Which three options for hardening a customer environment against misconfiguration are included in Prisma Cloud Compute compliance enforcement for hosts? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Navigate to Policies > Settings and ensure all severity levels are checked under "auto-enable default policies."
choices.A: Navigate to Policies > Settings and enable all severity levels in the alarm center.
choices.D: Navigate to Settings > Enterprise Settings and ensure all severity levels are checked under "auto-enable default policies."
choices.B: Navigate to Settings > Enterprise Settings and enable all severity levels in the alarm center.

questions.question_text: Taking which action will automatically enable all seventy levels?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Correct response is "D"

D

Step 1- To enable global settings for Prisma Cloud default policies click "Settings" and select "Enterprise Settings"
Step 2- To enable policies based on severity, select Auto enable new default policies of the typeâ€”Critical, High, Medium, Low or Informational. 

 and see the screenshot of Enterprise Settings, Auto-Enable Default Policies 

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-policies/manage-prisma-cloud-policies

Selected Answer: C
C

While some high severity policies are enabled to provide the best security outcomes, by default, policies of medium or low severity are in a disabled state

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin/prisma-cloud-policies/manage-prisma-cloud-policies

questions.question_text: Which two CI/CD plugins are supported by Prisma Cloud as part of its Code Security? (Choose two.)
Which policy type provides information about connections from suspicious IPs in a customer database?

choices.A: an event within the cloud account
choices.B: network traffic to the S3 bucket

questions.question_text:
An S3 bucket within AWS has generated an alert by violating the Prisma Cloud Default policy `AWS S3 buckets are accessible to public`. The policy definition follows: config where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name='aws-s3api-get-bucket-acl' AND json.rule="((((acl.grants[?(@.grantee=='AllUsers')] size > 0) or policyStatus.isPublic is true) and publicAccessBlockConfiguration does not exist) or ((acl.grants[?(@.grantee=='AllUsers')] size > 0) and publicAccessBlockConfiguration.ignorePublicAcis is false) or (policyStatus.isPublic is true and publicAccessBlockConfiguration.restrictPublicBuckets is false)) and websiteConfiguration does not exist"
Why did this alert get generated?

discussion.content: websiteConfiguration does not exist concerns about config not traffic. Therefore correct answer is C

Selected Answer: C
Correct option is C
